title: MrMojoRising26

created_time: September 23, 2023, 09:15:37 PMLast edit: October 06, 2023, 12:09:00 AM by MrMojoRising26
content: Up for auction is for coin #1 merlin/dragon funded with 0.001 BTC The coin has merlin on the front, and a dragon on the reverse of the coin The size is 60mm a lot larger than the previous coins I made, also the material is brass. Unfortunately coins #2-10 are all reserved. There are 10 coins made in total of this design ]STARTING BID: 0.001 BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT: 0.0002 BTCEND TIME: SEPTEMBER 25th, 2023, 13:00:00 PDT**PAYMENT DUE 24 HOURS AFTER AUCTION ENDS**PAYMENT ADDRESS: 3Q6xqVmawb3B176vvzkZUdUgxDyst9Z1yZSNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time. If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid.SHIPPING: $10 USD IF YOUR IN THE USA! IF OUTSIDE THE USA I WILL SHIP TO MINERJONES AND HE CAN RESHIP TO YOUR COUNTRY FEES WILL VARY DEPENDING ON LOCATION

comments.body: For those that asked about pure silver coins they are in the works.....coin of the left is pure silver! coin or the right is brass

comments.body: Yea these look great, MrMojo. Love the art, layout and composition. Just seeing your other pieces for the first time as well. And the fact that you’re doing these in-house it sounds like is cool, too.

comments.body: I agree with Krog, impressively looking coin, superb artwork, well done.I usually don't merit thins kind of posts, but this coin is... wow.

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: .008 btc (If I remember correctly you said last time these coins were done with laser etching or something like that correct ?  If so, I would say this is the future of physical bitcoin making imho, I wanted to bid on your last one but I think I saw M.J. Bidding on it so I passed on it for him, he deserved it for all the escrow work he does for me) I love the detail of this coin !!

comments.author: krogothmanhattan

comments.body: Damn this coin is a beauty  I am also a sucker for these wizards....mages and dragons...its been in my blood all my life.0.01BTC

comments.author: MrMojoRising26
comments.body: Quote from: Kialara on September 24, 2023, 07:26:32 AMYea these look great, MrMojo. Love the art, layout and composition. Just seeing your other pieces for the first time as well. And the fact that you’re doing these in-house it sounds like is cool, too. Wow you made my day Max thank you  @neurotic fish thanks as well @rsincognito yes it was made using a laser it takes about 1.5-2 hrs per side. I know it is not the traditional way of coin minting some people wont like that, but it has lots of benefits to it! I can go from a design concept to a coin in hand a lot faster. I can get a lot of details into the coin. I can personalize the coin info like adding someones name, and custom addy to it. If someone wanted to make it a DIY coin for example they can give me their btc address I can have that info put onto the coin, and send them a coin with a DIY hologram then they can assemble the key, and holo with no risk involved. The only downside to that way of doing it is resale value, but if someone plans on keeping it forever then it is perfect. I still plan on doin non laser minted coins as well, but for now i am just enjoying making coins playing around with ideas. I will probably do a mix of both going forward Thanks for the compliments everyone!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I really like this - my lasers can lightly etch (have used them to put pks on coins) but I cannot cut into the metal like this takes - looks great!
